member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.LocalReport.Refresh
member.summary: Causes the local report to be rendered with new data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.LocalReport.Render(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.CreateStreamCallback,Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format using a stream provided by a callback function.
member.param: A delegate function that will be used to provide a Stream object for rendering.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Only the EXCEL format is supported in this release.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.LocalReport.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported formats include Excel, PDF, and Image.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers. You can use them to render external resources (images, for example) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.summary: Indicates whether the report can be rendered if it has external images.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.LocalReport.EnableHyperlinks

member.name: F:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ParameterState.HasOutstandingDependencies
member.summary: The parameter has outstanding dependencies. This generally occurs when the valid values or the default value of a parameter is query-based and dependencies exist that have not been submitted to the method.

member.summary: A valid value for the parameter exists.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Report.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the Format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported extensions include XML, NULL, CSV, IMAGE, PDF, HTML4.0, HTML3.2, MHTML, EXCEL, and HTMLOWC.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers You can use them to render the external resources (images, etc.) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.summary: Loads the report definition from the report server using a .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ServerReport.Refresh
member.summary: Causes the report to be rendered with new data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ServerReport.Render(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String[]@,Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.Warning[]@)
member.summary: Processes the report and renders it in the specified format.
member.returns: A array of the report in the specified format.
member.param: [out] The filename extension used for the output file.
[out] The MIME type of the rendered report.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the report. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported formats include Excel, PDF, and Image.
[out] The encoding used when rendering the contents of the report.
[out] The stream identifiers. You can use them to render external resources (images, for example) that are associated with the report.
[out] An array of Warning[] objects that describes any warnings that occurred during report processing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Reporting.WebForms.ServerReport.RenderStream(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns a secondary stream associated with a processed report.
member.returns: A Byte[] array of the stream in the specified format. For more information about this data type, see "Byte Structure" in the Microsoft .NET Framework documentation.
member.param: The MIME type of the stream.

An XML string that contains the device-specific content that is required by the rendering extension specified in the format parameter. For more information about device information settings for specific output formats, see Device Information Settings.
The format in which to render the stream. This argument maps to a rendering extension. Supported extensions include XML, NULL, CSV, IMAGE, PDF, HTML4.0, HTML3.2, MHTML, EXCEL, and HTMLOWC.
The .NET Framework encoding class name.
The stream identifier.
